info.title: BCGPT - Basecamp Integration API
info.description: Complete Basecamp integration for ChatGPT with the full MCP toolset exposed over /action and /mcp.

x-assistant-instructions: Tool-Required Search Policy (Mandatory):
- For any request that implies searching Basecamp (find, search, look up, check, verify, list, open, summarize, which projects, who is, etc.), you MUST call the relevant tool(s) before responding.
- Never claim you found/confirmed anything unless you called a tool in this response and the result contained that data.
- If results are empty, explicitly say: "No results found." Offer next steps or alternative queries.
- Ask clarifying questions ONLY when the request is ambiguous (multiple exact matches).
- Prefer direct tools; use smart_action only when unsure which tool applies.
- Always include project name/id when returning project-scoped results.
Lookup Recipes:
- People search: use search_people (server-side). Only use list_all_people with query="" to list all people.
- Projects search: use search_projects. Use list_projects only when the user asks for a list.
- Cards search: use search_cards (project required unless index has cards), or search_entities for cross-entity lookup.
- Recordings/content: search_recordings -> if empty, offer narrower project scope or new query.
- Todos: search_todos -> if empty, offer project scope or broader query.
- Comments: list_comments with project + recording/card/todo id or URL -> if 404, ask for correct id or URL.
Chunked Responses:
- If a response returns cached=true with payload_key and chunk_count, you MUST call get_cached_payload_chunk (or export_cached_payload) to retrieve remaining data before concluding.
- Never filter or infer negatives from only the first chunk.
Project Membership ("Which projects is person X on?"):
- Resolve person via search_people (or list_all_people with query if necessary).
- list_projects for active projects (include archived if asked).
- For each project: list_project_people.
- Match by person id/email/name. Return only confirmed matches.
- If duplicates exist, ask to confirm which person BEFORE scanning memberships.
Creation/Mutation Rules:
- Changes (create/update/delete) require explicit confirmation if the user has not already confirmed intent.
- Echo the target identifiers (project id, recording/card/todo id, etc.) before executing.
- Provide idempotency_key for create/update operations when retrying or uncertain.
Result Formatting:
- Always include name/title, id, project context, and app_url when available.
- If results are partial (e.g., active-only), state the limitation.
Failure Handling:
- Surface tool errors clearly (code/message) and suggest next steps.
- If NOT_AUTHENTICATED, instruct user to run startbcgpt.
- Do not invent alternative data without tool calls.

post.summary: Show connection status, current user (name/email), plus re-auth and logout links.
Return account id + authorized accounts list.
List Basecamp accounts available to the authenticated user.
List projects (supports archived).
Resolve a project by name (fuzzy).
Across projects: totals + per-project breakdown + due today + overdue (open only).
Across projects: list open todos due on date; optionally include overdue.
Search open todos across all projects by keyword.
Group open todos by assignee within a project (optimized).
List todos assigned to a specific person within a project.
List todos assigned to the current user (optionally within a project).
Smart router: decide which action to call based on natural language query and context.
Search people by name/email (server-side).
Search projects by name.
Search cards by title/content (project required unless index is available).
List projects a person belongs to (by name, email, or ID).
List recent activity for a person (timeline-based).
Resolve a Basecamp UI/API URL into a structured entity reference.
Search across people/projects/recordings/todos (and cards by ID when project provided).
List todolists + todos for a project by name.
Create a to-do in a project; optionally specify todolist, due date, and assignees.
Update a to-do in a project. Fields omitted are preserved.
Get a to-do by ID.
List to-dos in a specific todolist.
Mark a to-do as incomplete.
Mark a to-do as complete.
Move/reposition a to-do within its list.
Complete a todo in a project by fuzzy-matching its content.
List card tables (kanban boards) for a project.
List columns for a card table.
List cards for a card table.
List card table summaries for a project, optionally including card titles.
Iterate card table summaries one board per call.
List card table contents for a project, chunked by boards.
Retrieve a chunk from the large payload cache.
Export a cached payload to a JSON file and return the file path.
Create a card in a card table.
Move/update a card (column/position).
Archive a card (recording).
Unarchive a card (recording).
Trash a card (recording).
List steps (checklist) for a card.
Create a step on a card. Provide official fields in body.
Update a card step. Provide official fields in body.
Mark a card step completed.
Mark a card step as incomplete.
Reposition a card step within its card.
Fetch the hill chart for a project (if enabled).
List message boards for a project.
List messages in a message board. If message_board_id omitted, uses the first board.
List message types (categories) for a project.
Get a message type (category) by ID.
Create a message type (category). Provide fields in body.
Update a message type (category). Provide fields in body.
Delete a message type (category).
Pin a message or other recording.
Unpin a message or other recording.
List client correspondences for a project.
Get a client correspondence by ID.
List client approvals for a project.
Get a client approval by ID.
List client replies for a correspondence/approval recording.
Get a specific client reply by recording + reply ID.
List documents/files in the project vault.
Get a vault by ID.
List child vaults within a vault.
Create a child vault within a vault. Provide official fields in body.
Update vault metadata. Provide official fields in body.
List schedule entries for a project (date range optional).
Search within a project (dock-driven search if enabled).
List all people visible in the Basecamp account (use empty query to list all).

query.description: Name or email to search for. Use empty string to list all.

deep_scan.description: Force a deep scan across project memberships.

include_archived_projects.description: Include archived projects when deep scanning.
